Use this data source to retrieve authorization server claim from Okta.


{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Okta = Pulumi.Okta;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var test = Output.Create(Okta.GetAuthServerClaim.InvokeAsync(new Okta.GetAuthServerClaimArgs
        {
            AuthServerId = "default",
            Name = "birthdate",
        }));
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-okta/sdk/v3/go/okta"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		opt0 := "birthdate"
		_, err := okta.GetAuthServerClaim(ctx, &GetAuthServerClaimArgs{
			AuthServerId: "default",
			Name:         &opt0,
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example python >}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_okta as okta

test = okta.get_auth_server_claim(auth_server_id="default",
    name="birthdate")
```

import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as okta from "@pulumi/okta";

## Using getAuthServerClaim {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

<a href="#claim_type_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">claim_<wbr>type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies whether the Claim is for an access token (`"RESOURCE"`) or ID token (`"IDENTITY"`).
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="scopes_python">
<a href="#scopes_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">scopes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies the scopes for this Claim.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="status_python">
<a href="#status_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">status</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Status of the claim.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="value_python">
<a href="#value_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Value of the claim
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="value_type_python">
<a href="#value_type_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">value_<wbr>type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies whether the Claim is an Okta EL expression (`"EXPRESSION"`), a set of groups (`"GROUPS"`), or a system claim (`"SYSTEM"`)
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="id_python">
<a href="#id_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}ID of the claim.
{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="name_python">
<a href="#name_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Name of the claim.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
